verses.verse: Wherefore, <WH199> Job,<WH347> I pray thee,<WH4994> hear<WH8085> my speeches,<WH4405> and hearken<WH238> to all<WH3605> my words.<WH1697>
Behold, <WH2009> now<WH4994> I have opened<WH6605> my mouth,<WH6310> my tongue<WH3956> hath spoken<WH1696> in my mouth.<WH2441>
My words<WH561> shall be of the uprightness<WH3476> of my heart:<WH3820> and my lips<WH8193> shall utter<WH4448> knowledge<WH1847> clearly.<WH1305>
The Spirit<WH7307> of God<WH410> hath made<WH6213> me, and the breath<WH5397> of the Almighty<WH7706> hath given me life.<WH2421>
If <WH518> thou canst<WH3201> answer<WH7725> me, set thy words in order<WH6186> before<WH6440> me, stand up.<WH3320>
Behold, <WH2005> I<WH589> am according to thy wish<WH6310> in God's<WH410> stead: I<WH589> also<WH1571> am formed<WH7169> out of the clay.<WH4480> <WH2563>
Behold, <WH2009> my terror<WH367> shall not<WH3808> make thee afraid,<WH1204> neither<WH3808> shall my hand<WH405> be heavy<WH3513> upon<WH5921> thee.
Surely <WH389> thou hast spoken<WH559> in mine hearing,<WH241> and I have heard<WH8085> the voice<WH6963> of thy words,<WH4405> saying,
I <WH589> am clean<WH2134> without<WH1097> transgression,<WH6588> I<WH595> am innocent;<WH2643> neither<WH3808> is there iniquity<WH5771> in me.
Behold, <WH2005> he findeth<WH4672> occasions<WH8569> against<WH5921> me, he counteth<WH2803> me for his enemy,<WH341>
He putteth<WH7760> my feet<WH7272> in the stocks,<WH5465> he marketh<WH8104> all<WH3605> my paths.<WH734>
Behold, <WH2005> in this<WH2063> thou art not<WH3808> just:<WH6663> I will answer<WH6030> thee, that<WH3588> God<WH433> is greater<WH7235> than man.<WH4480> <WH582>
Why <WH4069> dost thou strive<WH7378> against<WH413> him? for<WH3588> he giveth not<WH3808> account<WH6030> of any<WH3605> of his matters.<WH1697>
For <WH3588> God<WH410> speaketh<WH1696> once,<WH259> yea twice,<WH8147> yet man perceiveth<WH7789> it not.<WH3808>
In a dream,<WH2472> in a vision<WH2384> of the night,<WH3915> when deep sleep<WH8639> falleth<WH5307> upon<WH5921> men,<WH376> in slumberings<WH8572> upon<WH5921> the bed;<WH4904>
Then <WH227> he openeth<WH1540> the ears<WH241> of men,<WH376> and sealeth<WH2856> their instruction,<WH4561>
That he may withdraw<WH5493> man<WH120> from his purpose,<WH4639> and hide<WH3680> pride<WH1466> from man.<WH4480> <WH1397>
He keepeth back<WH2820> his soul<WH5315> from<WH4480> the pit,<WH7845> and his life<WH2416> from perishing<WH4480> <WH5674> by the sword.<WH7973>
He is chastened<WH3198> also with pain<WH4341> upon<WH5921> his bed,<WH4904> and the multitude<WH7230> of his bones<WH6106> with strong<WH386> pain:
So that his life<WH2416> abhorreth<WH2092> bread,<WH3899> and his soul<WH5315> dainty<WH8378> meat.<WH3978>
His flesh<WH1320> is consumed away,<WH3615> that it cannot be seen;<WH4480> <WH7210> and his bones<WH6106> that were not<WH3808> seen<WH7200> stick out.<WH8192>
Yea, his soul<WH5315> draweth near<WH7126> unto the grave,<WH7845> and his life<WH2416> to the destroyers.<WH4191>
If <WH518> there be<WH3426> a messenger<WH4397> with<WH5921> him, an interpreter,<WH3887> one<WH259> among<WH4480> a thousand,<WH505> to show<WH5046> unto man<WH120> his uprightness: <WH3476>
Then he is gracious<WH2603> unto him, and saith,<WH559> Deliver<WH6308> him from going down<WH4480> <WH3381> to the pit:<WH7845> I have found<WH4672> a ransom.<WH3724>
His flesh<WH1320> shall be fresher<WH7375> than a child's:<WH4480> <WH5290> he shall return<WH7725> to the days<WH3117> of his youth: <WH5934>

He shall pray<WH6279> unto<WH413> God,<WH433> and he will be favorable<WH7521> unto him: and he shall see<WH7200> his face<WH6440> with joy:<WH8643> for he will render<WH7725> unto man<WH582> his righteousness.<WH6666>
He looketh<WH7789> upon<WH5921> men,<WH376> and if any say,<WH559> I have sinned,<WH2398> and perverted<WH5753> that which was right,<WH3477> and it profited<WH7737> me not;<WH3808>
He will deliver<WH6299> his soul<WH5315> from going<WH4480> <WH5674> into the pit,<WH7845> and his life<WH2416> shall see<WH7200> the light.<WH216>
Lo, <WH2005> all<WH3605> these<WH428> things worketh<WH6466> God<WH410> oftentimes<WH6471> <WH7969> with<WH5973> man,<WH1397>
To bring back<WH7725> his soul<WH5315> from<WH4480> the pit,<WH7845> to be enlightened<WH215> with the light<WH216> of the living.<WH2416>
Mark well,<WH7181> O Job,<WH347> hearken<WH8085> unto me: hold thy peace,<WH2790> and I<WH595> will speak.<WH1696>
If <WH518> thou hast<WH3426> any thing to say,<WH4405> answer<WH7725> me: speak,<WH1696> for<WH3588> I desire<WH2654> to justify<WH6663> thee.
If <WH518> not,<WH369> hearken<WH8085> unto me: hold thy peace,<WH2790> and I shall teach<WH502> thee wisdom.<WH2451>
